answers.answer: You can't worry about your doctor thinking you are stupid--if the doctor thinks that way, I would get a new one.Just ask for a thyroid panel and for thyroid antibody tests to be done--blood is withdrawn.Take Care.

It sounds like you are experiencing hyperthyroid symptoms.  This can be really hard on the heart.  Go get a full panel blood test done for thyroid and everything else.  You might want to see a cardiologist, too.

I would be best to get a blood work up and then post your information.It sounds and I am kindly saying this --- but it sounds like you are trying to salvage your doctors feelings more than trying to communicate how you are feeling.I think your doctors position is to work for you - not you protecting him from having thought about you.If you don't feel good see your physician

I would also think abou diabetes?  Are you getting up in the night to go to the bathroom?  or have increased thirst?  Stick with it and get another opinion.  You know your body and you need to trust it:)

You should explore hyperthyroidism or whatever it is that ails you. I had your symptoms, racing heart, feeling crazy, etc. Turns out after 10 years of being wrongly dx as depressed, I have Graves Disease.

question: Please could you give me your advice, i recently went to see my doctor about severe anxiety that i have been suffering.  She prescribed me with beta blockers which  helped at first.  I am a trainee teacher which has been very stressful and am considering quitting because my health has become so bad.  Having read about thyroid disorders i have noticed alot of familiar symptoms.  I have been experiencing panic attacks especially in the morning and my heart is constantly racing, i have abdominal cramps and the runs.  My hands and legs also shake and i am reluctant to drink or eat in front of people because it is noticable. I have always been thin and find it virtually impossble to gain weight, i also go from extreme energy to lethargy.  I also have had continual eye problems for the least two years, my eyes go all red and swollen with a jelly consistency. I know that alot of these symptoms sound like anxiety but i really feel that there is more to it.  I have a good home life and feel that i am good at my job, it all seems over reactive and irrational at times like i am losing my mind.  Please could someone give me some advice, i don't want to approach my doctor in case they think i am being stupid, but i feel like i can't hide how i feel much longer, it is ruining my life.
title: YOUR OPINION PLEASE
